mxDW6zQKQ"]}},"version":1}

params._grandSumVerifier: the address of the grand sum KZG verifier
params._inclusionVerifier: the address of the inclusion KZG verifier
params._polynomialInterpolationVerifier: the address of the polynomial interpolation zkSNARK verifier
params._verifyingKey: The address of the verification key contract
params.balanceByteRange: maximum accepted byte range for the balance of a cryptocurrency
params.cryptocurrencyChains: the chain names of the cryptocurrencies whose balances are interpolated in the polynomials
params.cryptocurrencyNames: the names of the cryptocurrencies whose balances are interpolated in the polynomials

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.grandSumProof: kzg proof of the grand sum
params.snarkProof: ZK proof of the valid polynomial interpolation
params.timestamp: The timestamp at which the CEX took the snapshot of its assets and liabilities
params.totalBalances: The array of total balances in the grand sum

submitProofOfAddressOwnership((string,st.details: Submit an optimistic proof of multiple address ownership for a CEX. The proof is subject to an off-chain verification as it's not feasible to verify the signatures of non-EVM chains in an Ethereum smart contract.

params._addressOwnershipProofs: The list of address ownership proofs

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
